alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 4:05PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Coffee County through 445 PM CST... At 405 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brantley to near Opp to 11 miles southeast of Andalusia. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elba, Lee, Pine Level, Mixons Crossroads, Curtis, Carl Folsom A/p, Lowry Mill, Camp Humming Hills, Wise Mill, Roeton, Clowers Crossroads, Basin, Arcus, Woodland Grove Church, Jack, Java, Chestnut Grove, Victoria, Frisco and Danleys Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
